channel.title: RuneScape 2007 PK Server - [U]21/05/06 - Clipped Follow & Projectiles
channel.description:
[center][size=18pt][b]RuneScape 2007 PK Server[/b][/size] The name is not official, I'm just using it temporary until I find a actual name for the server [/center]
[b][b]Base[/b][/b]; RiotScape [b][b]Client Base[/b][/b]; Galkon's Refactored 474 look-alike
[left][b][u]About[/u][/b] Welcome to my project, [b]RS2007[/b]
Not many of you know me, but I hope that you will support what I do. Although if you don't like what I do, please feel free to leave a post commenting how you feel I could improve.
RS2007 is based of [b]RiotScape[/b], by [b]Lmctruck30[/b], [b]Graham[/b] and [b]Blakeman[/b]. It is an decent framework build on MINA networking with an decent benchmark far above the standard WinterLove source. Aswell as being stable, it is also build with many convention based and highly efficent systems.
My server is currently using the [b]317[/b] revision but are loading 474 data and will be limited to the 474 revision.[/left]
The client include
[ul][li]474 Animations[/li] [li]474 Graphics[/li] [li]474 NPCS[/li] [li]474 Items[/li] [li]474 Objects[/li] [li]474 IDK[/li] [li]474 Maps[/li][/ul]
[b]Thanks to[/b]
[ul][li]Graham[/li] [li]Lmctruck30[/li] [li]Blakeman[/li][/ul]
[img]http://puu.sh/3jUEJ.png[/img] [img]http://puu.sh/3ilbG.png[/img] [img]http://puu.sh/3ilcN.png[/img] [img]http://puu.sh/3ee8S.png[/img]

item.title: RuneScape 2007 PK Server - [U]21/05/06 - Clipped Follow & Projectiles
item.dc:creator: @Chronicles Chronicles
item.description:
@Chronicles wrote:

Mezzyscape562:

Oh here we go again, another remake which will somehow end up dead. Why would you even start a 2007 remake, runescape 2007 is out there, and there are already other 2007 Remakes… How come nobody does a 194 Remake, i’m getting tired of all those remakes it’s annoying and pointless.

Sorry for the confusion Mezzy, it’s not a remake, merely a PK server, that is based around the 07 era.

And for the 194, I was working on a remake back in 2011 based around 194

[youtube]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sDAIbrU3igc[/youtube]
Q: Is it possible that the source and client will be released so people can make their own server with this?
A: I don’t think I will release it.

Read full topic
item.source: RuneScape 2007 PK Server - [U]21/05/06 - Clipped Follow & Projectiles

item.title: RuneScape 2007 PK Server - [U]21/05/06 - Clipped Follow & Projectiles
item.dc:creator: @Chronicles Chronicles
item.description:
@Chronicles wrote:

[quote=“Uncalled, post:4, topic:521377”]Like I’ve stated in many other threads prior to this: Make your thread more detailed. Attract attention through your server development thread. If you have worked hard on your thread’s template, it shows dedication. If people see that you’ve shown dedication to your server, they’ll be more likely to follow your project. If you get more filler in your thread, proper grammar and punctuation (not really a necessity, but it’s good for show), and a good development going - then people are bound to support your project more. I understand that the task is tedious, and something you may not be interested in, but if you want a good following for your development, I really suggest in taking time on your thread.

@OP:
I like the development. It’s got an oldschool style to it that I really dig. I do have one suggestion, however. Make sure that you only post pictures of unique features in your server. That way people can see everything that you’ve added, and not just, “hey, look! I have KBD!”[/quote]

I have followed your suggestion and tried to optimize my thread template. Thanks alot.

Read full topic
item.source: RuneScape 2007 PK Server - [U]21/05/06 - Clipped Follow & Projectiles

item.title: RuneScape 2007 PK Server - [U]21/05/06 - Clipped Follow & Projectiles
item.dc:creator: @Uncalled Uncalled
item.description:
@Uncalled wrote:

Like I’ve stated in many other threads prior to this: Make your thread more detailed. Attract attention through your server development thread. If you have worked hard on your thread’s template, it shows dedication. If people see that you’ve shown dedication to your server, they’ll be more likely to follow your project. If you get more filler in your thread, proper grammar and punctuation (not really a necessity, but it’s good for show), and a good development going - then people are bound to support your project more. I understand that the task is tedious, and something you may not be interested in, but if you want a good following for your development, I really suggest in taking time on your thread.

@OP:
I like the development. It’s got an oldschool style to it that I really dig. I do have one suggestion, however. Make sure that you only post pictures of unique features in your server. That way people can see everything that you’ve added, and not just, “hey, look! I have KBD!”

Read full topic
